data.title: Scholarships — Association of Latino Administrators and Superintendents
data.meta_site_name: Association of Latino Administrators and Superintendents
data.text:
The Association of Latino Administrators and Superintendents in partnership with Curriculum Associates recognize Latino administrators for their leadership by providing assistance toward an advanced degree in education.

Curriculum Associates will award one (1) $10,000 scholarship for a seventh consecutive year to the top ALAS candidate. The scholarship is available to ALAS members seeking to continue their advanced degree program in education in a college or university with the goal of becoming a superintendent! The scholarship is made payable to the recipients’ institution of higher learning and is awarded during the Annual ALAS National Education Summit in the fall.

NCU is an online, nonprofit, graduate-focused institution with a robust School of Education. Master’s degree, EdD, and PhD programs include:

- Education

- Educational Leadership

- Instructional Design

- Teaching

- Social and Emotional Learning

We’re pleased to announce a partnership with Northcentral University that will expand access to higher education for our members. ALAS members receive one (1) free course and a preferred reduced tuition rate that is 25 percent off the published tuition rates and up to six transfer credits from the ALAS Leadership Academy.*

Programs are designed to meet the needs of working professionals. NCU offers a 1:1 learning model taught by 100% doctoral faculty, and classes start every Monday – no residency or GRE/GMAT required.

If you’re ABD, NCU can help with our Dissertation Completion Pathway. Enroll today to receive a tuition reduction of 15 – 25%, depending on your program option.*

Please visit https://www.ncu.edu/alas or contact us at 844-628-7268. You can also contact Heather at hmillward@ncu.edu.

*Excludes Dissertation Completion Pathway and John F. Kennedy School of Law programs and certificate programs
